title: ERROR CORS Rejected with Besu 22.4.2 and Metamask

### Description
Never mind, I figured this out. I works when I add --host-allowlist="*" --rpc-http-cors-origins=all. I have open access because I'm testing and learning how to run the mode. My full command line that works is:

./besu --network=goerli --sync-mode=FAST --data-path=/home/stan/beacon/databases/goerli --rpc-http-enabled=true --rpc-http-host=127.0.0.1 --rpc-http-port=8545 --rpc-http-api=ETH,NET,WEB3 --host-allowlist="*" --rpc-http-cors-origins=all

I installed Besu 22.4.2 on Ubuntu 20.04 (local PC) and it started fine on Goerli testnet and I was running it for a day. When I try to use Metamask and connect to Localhost 8545 I started getting CORS Rejected errors. The error details are below. I get the same error with Oracle JDK18, JDK17 and JDK 11. Even if I stop and start besu I always get the CORS error even if I don't try to connect Metamask. The first Metamask connection trigger the CORS Rejected error and it is persistence even on restarts.  Can someone help me fix this error? I tried every step by step installation I can find to no avail. Thank  you in advance.
